results.title: What is an amphibian?
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film illustrates the body structure and life process of amphibians and shows their adaptation to life in water and on land. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: The Karate kid. Part 2
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen and Jerry Weintraub
results.brief_description: Karate kid, Daniel travels to Japan with his teacher, Miyagi, to visit Miyagi’s dying father. It’s a troubled trip for Daniel and his teacher as Miyagi returns to face his sworn enemy. Daniel becomes involved in the hate-ridden vendetta and whereas before he fought in a contest where a trophy was at stake, Daniel now plays a game that’s a fight to the death.

results.title: Warlords III: Reign of Heroes for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Studies Group and Red Orb Entertainment
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, advert, card game advert, registration card, troubleshooting guide, internet guide and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: The third instalment in the Warlords series boasts improved graphics throughout and retains much of the same turn-based strategy gameplay as its predecessors. The units a player can train are now not set to a specific clan, as new types of units from different clans can join the player’s faction. Also new to the series is the addition of diplomacy, where a player can forge treaties with others and conquer opponents together. This includes the ability to bribe others in order to influence their decisions. Lastly, while the game still allows for hotseat and play by email multiplayer, it now has the ability to play over the internet.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Strategic Studies Group and Red Orb Entertainment

Also new to the series is the addition of diplomacy, where a player can forge treaties with others and conquer opponents together. This includes the ability to bribe others in order to influence their decisions. Lastly, while the game still allows for hotseat and play by email multiplayer, it now has the ability to play over the internet.

results.title: Emulation of Warlords III: Reign of Heroes for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Studies Group and Red Orb Entertainment
results.brief_description: The third instalment in the Warlords series boasts improved graphics throughout and retains much of the same turn-based strategy gameplay as its predecessors. The units a player can train are now not set to a specific clan, as new types of units from different clans can join the player’s faction. Also new to the series is the addition of diplomacy, where a player can forge treaties with others and conquer opponents together. This includes the ability to bribe others in order to influence their decisions. Lastly, while the game still allows for hotseat and play by email multiplayer, it now has the ability to play over the internet.
results.title_for_label: Emulation of Warlords III: Reign of Heroes for PC
results.creator_credit_for_label: Strategic Studies Group and Red Orb Entertainment
results.description: The third instalment in the Warlords series boasts improved graphics throughout and retains much of the same turn-based strategy gameplay as its predecessors. The units a player can train are now not set to a specific clan, as new types of units from different clans can join the player’s faction. Also new to the series is the addition of diplomacy, where a player can forge treaties with others and conquer opponents together. This includes the ability to bribe others in order to influence their decisions. Lastly, while the game still allows for hotseat and play by email multiplayer, it now has the ability to play over the internet.

results.title: What is a fish
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Illustrates the major types of fish showing the anatomy of a typical fish, behaviour patterns such as commensalism, spawning, predation and territoriality.

results.title: The Jungle Book
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.credit_line:
Disney Studio Artist

Story Sketch

Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.material_description: Conte crayon, marker, and ink on paper
results.brief_description: Another animated classic from the Disney studios. Mowgli, the man-cub raised by wolves, must leave the jungle to take his place in the man-village. The journey is a dangerous one as Shere-Khan, the mighty tiger has sworn to kill the man-cub. Mowgli, accompanied by his loyal friends, Bagheera the panther, and Baloo, the irresponsible bear, meet an array of friends who help Mowgli escape Shere-Khan. A delightful score and voices by stars such as Phil Harris, George Sanders and Sebastion Cabot, make this a “song-filled celebration you’ll never forget.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.description:
When the jungle comes alive with rumours of the man-hating tiger Shere Khan’s return, the wise panther Bagheera knows he’ll have to get the man-cub Mowgli to safety. After being raised by wolves in the Indian jungle, Mowgli is reluctant to leave his home – despite the impending danger. Under the guidance of Bagheera and the laid-back bear Baloo, Mowgli adventures through the jungle to discover friendship, loyalty and his place in the world, while meeting a fabulous cast of friends and foes.

The Jungle Book (1967), Walt Disney Animation Studio’s classic musical adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s beloved book, has been an animated favourite for over 50 years and features the voice talents of some of the biggest stars of the day, as well as gorgeous animation, classic characters and iconic music and songs from the Sherman Brothers and Terry Gilkyson.

Frank Thomas and Ollie Johnston supervised the animation for Mowgli and Baloo, who feature in the above sketch. The contrasting size and movements of the young boy and easy-going bear balance one another throughout the film. In the lively musical sequence the “Bare Necessities”, Mowgli appears clumsy and a little unsure while the wise Baloo dances gracefully to the rhythm of the accompanying jazz music, all the while showing Mowgli the ways of the jungle.
description_for_label:

The Jungle Book (1967), Walt Disney Animation Studio’s classic musical adaptation of Rudyard Kipling’s beloved book, has been an animated favourite for over 50 years and features the voice talents of some of the biggest stars of the day, as well as gorgeous animation, classic characters and iconic music and songs from the Sherman Brothers and Terry Gilkyson.

Frank Thomas and Ollie Johnston supervised the animation for Mowgli and Baloo, who feature in the above sketch. The contrasting size and movements of the young boy and easy-going bear balance one another throughout the film. In the lively musical sequence the “Bare Necessities”, Mowgli appears clumsy and a little unsure while the wise Baloo dances gracefully to the rhythm of the accompanying jazz music, all the while showing Mowgli the ways of the jungle.

results.title: The Joy Luck Club
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Amy Tan, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, “The Joy Luck Club” tells the story of two generations of Chinese women. Four are mothers and wives who emigrated from China to build new lives and families in the United States. The other four are their Chinese-American daughters who are struggling to define their own identities against the expectations of their mothers and the American society where they live. Wayne Wang masterfully interweaves the stories of the eight women which spans from feudal China to modern America, highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations. “The Joy Luck Club” is a beautiful film to watch, with lavish production values which make the characters’ stories even more compelling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Wang, Amy Tan, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass and Hollywood Pictures

results.title: The Punisher for NES
results.creator_credit: Beam Software and LJN Entertainment, Inc.
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, plastic cartridge case, registration card, poster, Nintendo Power advert and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: The Punisher puts the player in control of Frank Castle, and his iconic anti-hero persona, The Punisher. The game itself is an on-rails shooter, where the player can move left and right along the screen to avoid enemy gunfire but is otherwise automatically guided through each level. Levels are both packed with enemies and destructible objects, sometimes hiding powerups. These powerups include ammo, armour, grenades, and additional heath. The Punisher has six overall missions with a variety of environments and levels within each. Killing all the enemies in a level gives additional bonuses in the next stage, like extra grenades, ammo and an unlimited ‘super gun’ upgrade. The game ends with a gun and fistfight against the notorious villain Kingpin.

results.title: The Jointed-legged animals: arthropods
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
This film shows the jointed-legged animals and the structural and functional characteristics of animals in the phylum arthropoda: examples from each of the five classes, and their evolutionary development. Metamorphosis and moulting processes are illustrated using photo-micrography and time-lapse photography. The economic importance to man is discussed. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description:

results.title: Flatworms: platyhelminthes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
After brief views of land, fresh water, marine and parasitic flatworms, shows the important characteristics of the common planaria. These are the simplest animals with bilateral symmetry, a distinct head, a central nervous system and a substantially developed mesoderm layer. Their regenerative ability is demonstrated, showing polarity, the anterior-posterior gradient and cell dominance.
